intro: Derris nicou, commonly known as the African snakeroot, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its roots contain toxic alkaloids, which have been used traditionally for their medicinal and pesticidal properties. The plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
